abstract: Afghan officials believe at least 25 civilians died in Helmand Province after shelling during fierce firefight in Sangin district struck wedding party; violence in area has increased significantly in last year, reflecting deadlier confrontations between Afghan forces and Taliban.
lead_paragraph: Officials said they had begun an investigation of the attack, which wounded more than 50 people, mostly women and children.

byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and TAIMOOR SHAH

snippet: Officials said they had begun an investigation of the attack, which wounded more than 50 people, mostly women and children.

headline.main: Shelling Strikes Afghan Wedding Party, Killing at Least 25 Civilians
headline.print_headline: Shelling Strikes Afghan Wedding Party, Killing at Least 25
